trans-unit.source: Restore data to a Windows Server or Windows Client from Azure | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Restore data to a Windows Server or Windows Client from Azure | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to restore from a Windows Server or Windows Client.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to restore from a Windows Server or Windows Client.

trans-unit.source: This article covers the steps required to perform two types of restore operations:
trans-unit.target: This article covers the steps required to perform two types of restore operations:

trans-unit.source: Restore data to the same machine from which the backups were taken.
trans-unit.target: Restore data to the same machine from which the backups were taken.

trans-unit.source: Restore data to any other machine.
trans-unit.target: Restore data to any other machine.

trans-unit.source: In both cases, the data is retrieved from the Azure Backup vault.
trans-unit.target: In both cases, the data is retrieved from the Azure Backup vault.

trans-unit.source: If you accidentally deleted a file and wish to restore it to the same machine (from which the backup is taken), the following steps will help you recover the data.
trans-unit.target: If you accidentally deleted a file and wish to restore it to the same machine (from which the backup is taken), the following steps will help you recover the data.

trans-unit.source: Open the Microsoft Azure Backup snap in.
trans-unit.target: Open the Microsoft Azure Backup snap in.

trans-unit.source: Click Recover Data to initiate the workflow.
trans-unit.target: Click Recover Data to initiate the workflow.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Recover Data</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Recover Data</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the This server (*yourmachinename*) option to restore the backed up file on the same machine.
trans-unit.target: Select the This server (*yourmachinename*) option to restore the backed up file on the same machine.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Same machine</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Same machine</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Choose to Browse for files or Search for files.
trans-unit.target: Choose to Browse for files or Search for files.

trans-unit.source: Leave the default option if you plan to restore one or more files whose path is known.
trans-unit.target: Leave the default option if you plan to restore one or more files whose path is known.

trans-unit.source: If you are not sure about the folder structure but would like to search for a file, pick the Search for files option.
trans-unit.target: If you are not sure about the folder structure but would like to search for a file, pick the Search for files option.

trans-unit.source: For the purpose of this section, we will proceed with the default option.
trans-unit.target: For the purpose of this section, we will proceed with the default option.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Browse files</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Browse files</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the volume from which you wish to restore the file.
trans-unit.target: Select the volume from which you wish to restore the file.

trans-unit.source: You can restore from any point in time.
trans-unit.target: You can restore from any point in time.

trans-unit.source: Dates which appear in bold in the calendar control indicate the availability of a restore point.
trans-unit.target: Dates which appear in bold in the calendar control indicate the availability of a restore point.

trans-unit.source: Once a date is selected, based on your backup schedule (and the success of a backup operation), you can select a point in time from the Time drop down.
trans-unit.target: Once a date is selected, based on your backup schedule (and the success of a backup operation), you can select a point in time from the Time drop down.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Volume and Date</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Volume and Date</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the items to recover.
trans-unit.target: Select the items to recover.

trans-unit.source: You can multi-select folders/files you wish to restore.
trans-unit.target: You can multi-select folders/files you wish to restore.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select files</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select files</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Specify the recovery parameters.
trans-unit.target: Specify the recovery parameters.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Recovery options</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Recovery options</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You have an option of restoring to the original location (in which the file/folder would be overwritten) or to another location in the same machine.
trans-unit.target: You have an option of restoring to the original location (in which the file/folder would be overwritten) or to another location in the same machine.

trans-unit.source: If the file/folder you wish to restore exists in the target location, you can create copies (two versions of the same file), overwrite the files in the target location, or skip the recovery of the files which exist in the target.
trans-unit.target: If the file/folder you wish to restore exists in the target location, you can create copies (two versions of the same file), overwrite the files in the target location, or skip the recovery of the files which exist in the target.

trans-unit.source: It is highly recommended that you leave the default option of restoring the ACLs on the files which are being recovered.
trans-unit.target: It is highly recommended that you leave the default option of restoring the ACLs on the files which are being recovered.

trans-unit.source: Once these inputs are provided, click Next.
trans-unit.target: Once these inputs are provided, click Next.

trans-unit.source: The recovery workflow, which restores the files to this machine, will begin.
trans-unit.target: The recovery workflow, which restores the files to this machine, will begin.

trans-unit.source: If your entire server is lost, you can still recover data from Azure Backup to a different machine.
trans-unit.target: If your entire server is lost, you can still recover data from Azure Backup to a different machine.

trans-unit.source: The following steps illustrate the workflow.
trans-unit.target: The following steps illustrate the workflow.

trans-unit.source: The terminology used in these steps includes:
trans-unit.target: The terminology used in these steps includes:

trans-unit.source: Source machine – The original machine from which the backup was taken and which is currently unavailable.
trans-unit.target: Source machine – The original machine from which the backup was taken and which is currently unavailable.

trans-unit.source: Target machine – The machine to which the data is being recovered.
trans-unit.target: Target machine – The machine to which the data is being recovered.

trans-unit.source: Sample vault – The Backup vault to which the Source machine and Target machine are registered.
trans-unit.target: Sample vault – The Backup vault to which the Source machine and Target machine are registered.

trans-unit.source: Backups taken from a machine cannot be restored on a machine which is running an earlier version of the operating system.
trans-unit.target: Backups taken from a machine cannot be restored on a machine which is running an earlier version of the operating system.

trans-unit.source: For example, if backups are taken from a Windows 7 machine, it can be restored on a Windows 8 or above machine.
trans-unit.target: For example, if backups are taken from a Windows 7 machine, it can be restored on a Windows 8 or above machine.

trans-unit.source: However the vice-versa does not hold true.
trans-unit.target: However the vice-versa does not hold true.

trans-unit.source: Open the Microsoft Azure Backup snap in on the Target machine.
trans-unit.target: Open the Microsoft Azure Backup snap in on the Target machine.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the Target machine and the Source machine are registered to the same backup vault.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the Target machine and the Source machine are registered to the same backup vault.

trans-unit.source: Click Recover Data to initiate the workflow.
trans-unit.target: Click Recover Data to initiate the workflow.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Recover Data</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Recover Data</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Another server
trans-unit.target: Select Another server

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Another Server</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Another Server</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Provide the vault credential file that corresponds to the Sample vault.
trans-unit.target: Provide the vault credential file that corresponds to the Sample vault.

trans-unit.source: If the vault credential file is invalid (or expired) download a new vault credential file from the Sample vault in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: If the vault credential file is invalid (or expired) download a new vault credential file from the Sample vault in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Once the vault credential file is provided, the backup vault against the vault credential file is displayed.
trans-unit.target: Once the vault credential file is provided, the backup vault against the vault credential file is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Select the Source machine from the list of displayed machines.
trans-unit.target: Select the Source machine from the list of displayed machines.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>List of machines</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>List of machines</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select either the Search for files or Browse for files option.
trans-unit.target: Select either the Search for files or Browse for files option.

trans-unit.source: For the purpose of this section, we will use the Search for files option.
trans-unit.target: For the purpose of this section, we will use the Search for files option.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Search</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Search</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the volume and date in the next screen.
trans-unit.target: Select the volume and date in the next screen.

trans-unit.source: Search for the folder/file name you want to restore.
trans-unit.target: Search for the folder/file name you want to restore.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Search items</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Search items</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the location where the files need to be restored.
trans-unit.target: Select the location where the files need to be restored.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Restore location</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Restore location</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Provide the encryption passphrase that was provided during Source machine’s registration to Sample vault.
trans-unit.target: Provide the encryption passphrase that was provided during Source machine’s registration to Sample vault.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Encryption</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Encryption</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once the input is provided, click Recover, which triggers the restore of the backed up files to the destination provided.
trans-unit.target: Once the input is provided, click Recover, which triggers the restore of the backed up files to the destination provided.

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Backup FAQ</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: Visit the <linkText>Azure Backup Forum</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Backup Overview</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Backup Azure virtual machines</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Backup up Microsoft workloads</linkText><title></title>
